Elford Dec[superscript]r[/superscript]. 21 [superscript]st[/superscript]. 1818
My dear Harriette and Sneyd.This little
div.p:
This little
pebble brooch will reach you I hope just
in time for your to give it for with my
true love to Harriette for a christmas box
- a very [underline]very[/underline] little one it is - but it is that
which you preferred and it has been
set exactly. like the others and by the
same person Gray-
We have spent a very pleasant day
and a half at M[superscript]r[/superscript]. & M[superscript]rs[/superscript]. Sneyd Emma
Honora and I at this delightfully neat
pretty place with M[superscript]r[/superscript]. John Sneyd, who
[underline]notwithstanding[/underline] all I had heard be
forehand of his agreeableness does not
disappoint me - but far exceeds my ex
-pectations - His humor is so easy and
joined with such quiet good breeding
that it always pleases me much as it amus
esamuses and never goes a hairs breadth too
far nor half a note nor a hundredth part
of a note too high for the most delicate
soul of sympathy. He has treated us
with the sight of a great number of his
own drawings which are admirable
in the style of Bunbury or rather in an
original style of his own - 1[superscript]st[/superscript]. course
served to us was a set of designs for Castle
Rackrent - these he shewed me at Byrkley

Lodge [del]and as[/del] I expressed a wish to have pos
sessionpossession of a striking likeness of Captain Mony
gawlMonygawl a charming officer whose [del]looks[/del] conde
scendingcondescending smile becomes the hero lowering
himself to the level of the ladies’ capacity
- Mr. J. Sneyd said he would copy this for
me if he could but to my surprise when
we came here I found he had made
a complete set of copies of all the Castle
Rackrent designs for me. - He next shewed
us his designs for Tom Jones - Then a
set for Crabbe’s tales- excellent - but I do not
know Crabbe well enough to feel all their
merit. I will take a course of Crabbe on pur
posepurpose to understand these designs - Those he
has done for the Bath Guide are admirable
- - How I wish we could have seen all
these things together my dear S & H - And
particularly I wish we could have looked
over together a portfolio of drawings &
etchings from drawings of Lady Caroline
Wortley’s - the parting of Hector and Androma
cheAndromache - and a representation of Adronmache
with her child - and alone. the hour after
the parting - also Coriolanus & his wife -
and many others that reminded me
Flaxman & of Sneyd’s tracings from them
- He shewed me these in consequence of
my shewing him some tracings I had
made from Charlotte’s drawings which
he much admired - I consulted him on
the propriety of publishing a few specimens
of these in my fathers life - he much approved
